divs: sighting detailsit was a little after 11:00 pm, i was sitting in my back yard, looking up to the sky to watch a few of the neighborhood fireworks. then, at approximately 11:11, i saw the first one. coming from the west, i saw a bright reddish\orange oval shaped object flying in the sky. i would say it was pretty high up in the sky. it wasnt as if it were an object going up from the ground like a firework. there was a definate flight path. it was moving at a speed similar to what one would see if looking at a plane up in the sky. i saw it travel for at least one or two minutes, then it just disappeared. i called my husband out, he saw it too. about 3 minutes later, we saw another one, coming from the west, but not from the same point in the sky. we watched it travel for the same amount of time, then it, too, disappeared, but it disappeared in the same area in my vantage point as the previous one had. the third one appeared from a different direction of the west (more southwest, i would say), and it was so bright, i could see it coming toward us across the sky through the trees in my backyard. it too, headed in the same direction (west to northeast) and disappeared at about the same spot that the first two had. i went upstairs to grab my cel phone to see if my son had seen anything, and about 3 minutes in the phone call, i saw another one coming from the west, more north then the other three, and it also disappeared in the same area of the other 3. these were not quick sightings. all 4 were visable for at least one or two minutes, if not longer. they looked like a bright reddish\orange color. almost like the color of fire. best description of the color i would say is, sometimes when the sun sets, it becomes a glowing, firey color. they reminded me of fire, just by the color. the night was clear, so i could see there was no vapor trail. no smoke trail, nothing like that. i did notice the one that came overhead had no sound. these were not fireworks. they all four came from a different direction in the western sky. they were big enough for my husband and i to see them. and they all four went toward the same area in the sky and then completely just disappeared. when these ovals of fire disappeared, they became white first, then disappeared. when they did become white, it was as if they then in a way, began to look like a star, but not as bright. then they just faded out. it was strange. i have never in my life seen anything like it. when i saw the first one, i knew there was something strange going on, and when i saw 3 more of them, i was completely amazed. shocked in a way, to witness so many of them at one time. i kept wanting to see more and more, because i just could not believe what i was seeing. if not for my husband seeing them, also, i really dont know anyone would have believed me. with it being july 4th, people dismiss it as fireworks. well....these ovals of fire that was traveling miles above the earth, were not fireworks. they came from different directions, disappeared in the same area. and honestly, one of my first thoughts was: what a perfect night for them to be out. with all the fireworks, they must have thought that they were blending right in. it only makes sense they would have picked last night to do a flyby.
Summary: 4 reddish/orange ovals, heading from west to north east.
trends: There have been 9 other sightings in Brownsburg
There were no other sightings in Brownsburg on or around July 4th 2010
